Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: kamje
Reviews.Content: Three sisters travelling to Berlin and staying at Brandenburger Hof. This is a very comfortable hotel with a staff and a chef that are excellent. The rooms were very nice and comfortable, and when one of us felt the bed was too hard to sleep in, this was changed immediately. We were in Berlin around Christmas, and the decorations in the hotel was nice, not too much. We had breakfast in the lovely covered court yard. The hotel is located in the centre of Berlin. My sisters and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small gem hotel with Michelin star restaurant 2 blocks off Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: jacbalt
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here two nights, but it was a big part of our memories of Berlin. The room was very comfortable and we found welcoming goodies each night to satisfy a sweet tooth. Hotel is both old and new at the same time. It has the facade of a many decades old building that may have escaped war damage, but more likely was built to look like it survived. The building next door was built in late 1800's, was bombed in the war and rebuilt after 1945. In any case, the architecture fits and the traditional and modern touches inside the hotel with a courtyard, art and sculpture give this a special feel. We hadn't ordered the breakfast when we ordered our room on line, but should have. If you want the hustle/bustle of a large hotel, look elsewhere. This is an intimate, private hotel with high quality service. It's location was an easy 2 block walk to the Kurfurstendamm (or Ku'damm), only 4 blocks from the Berlin Literary House and its famous Wintergreen Cafe and garden on Fasanenstrausse. In the other direction by 2 blocks is KaDeWe, the fabulous 7+ story department store with high quality and designer goods and the most impressive fresh and prepared foods sales and cafe. The liveliest area on that floor was the oyster bar. We decided that if we lived in Berlin, it would be tempting to eat here often for lunch or dinner. Anything gourmet you'd want to buy would be here fresh, or cooked for consuming there or ready to go home. However, at the Brandenburger Hof you'll want to consider being dazzled one evening in the Michelin 1 star Quadriga Restaurant. The multi-course meal was inventive, insanely flavorful, with impeccable service and will be forever memorable. It was a profound cap to our last day in Berlin. We can't wait to see the movie, "Goodbye Lenin" again to reminisce and relive our wonderful fun visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and well located”
Reviews.Author: JC64Madeira
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked by my company as I attended a fair. The hotel is very nice, elegantly appointed and well located (walking distance from Ku'Dam). Staff is truly great, very polite and friendly. Breakfast is superb. My room was large and quiet (215) with nice bathroom amenities; I suggest the management to upgrade the bedding (mattresses) and to add a safe deposit. Plugs for computer could be over the desk and not under. Only negative point as far as I am concerned; not only Internet is not for free, but one has to pay fees for every device.

Reviews.Title: “I would always here when in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Paulben60
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable ,warm and friendly staff,wonderful large room,great location and fab place to eat breakfast in the covered courtyard.Excellent Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: SerGioDubai
Reviews.Content: Great really. Luxury service, brilliant consierge. Great sleep. Loved the restaurant too. Location is right in the middle of the downtown area. We asked for booking 6 tickets for a concert in the evening and everything went smooth. Note this is a small intimate property, so do not expect large facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Inimate and high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gorodetsky
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean and high standard medium size hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Maybe one of the best gourmet breakfast I have been served in a hotel. Good central locatiom close to the U-bahn and a few min. walk from the Kodam but still in a relatively quiet street, nice restaurants arround.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, gracious service”
Reviews.Author: pickynotsnooty
Reviews.Content: Just got back this morning from 2 nights in Berlin and stayed here on a friend's recommendation. It is modern, comfortable, conveniently located yet on a quiet street, and has a fine restaurant. The staff were universally helpful and friendly. It is a small hotel and plenty luxurious, but with an unpretentious German flair that my wife and I found charming. It is also exquisitely designed, especially the spectacular Die Quadriga restaurant and lovely courtyard garden.

Reviews.Title: “A 3.5 star hotel not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Carole2011
Reviews.Content: Never have we stayed in a 5 star hotel to find the room does not have airconditioning.At night if we had the window open we heard noises all through the night, plus light flooded in.We then pulled the drapes and the room heated up as the window would not stay open!Staff were pleasant and helpful, room was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is in a good position but for the money I would recommend another hotel with aircon. It was not hot either while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should be for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pablot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 5 or 6 years and this time was a big disappointment. Firstly they neglected to tell me the change in policy when making a reservation, i.e. you have to print off the e-mail "confirmation" sign it and send it back. Because I had not done this (and was not told to do this when I made my telephone reservation) they were full for the first night so I had to stay elsewhere, no real apology and no telephone call the day before as promised to let me know of any cancellations.....not a good start. The other issues are [1] NO AIR CON - Berlin was very hot and the very small 5th floor room was incredibly uncomfortable. [2] The prices of the food in the Garden Lounge v the quality is not as good as it once was. [3] Service overall is OK but not great and for this sort of hotel it should be exceptional. I would say that this is not a 5 star hotel and really a good 4 star, no more. Not sure if I will be back after some years of good excellent but now a quite poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, intimate hotel at walking distance from Kurfürstendamm”
Reviews.Author: hennessyparadis
Reviews.Content: Brandenburger Hof is located on a very quiet street, just a few blocks from the beginning of Kurfürstendamm and is thus rather ideal for a shopping spree in Berlin. The hotel has over 70 rooms, but it feels smaller and more intimate than that. The staff are particularly attentive. We stayed in a Double city view room. The room itself was decently sized but not big, but with nice details such as a Corbusier sofa and other tasteful items. The heart of the hotel is the lounge / restaurant area, which features a wonderful Japanese style garden inside the lounge itself. The lounge area is covered with a high-ceiling glass roof, so expect wonderful natural light at breakfast! The American breakfast is very good. It is served à la carte. I would highly recommend guests to try out the hotel's restaurant Die Quadriga which serves interesting menus with Finnish/Scandinavian twists.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! Our home from home in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: ACanadianinDublin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to travel to Berlin for our joint birthday this year - and both this wonderful city and the delightful Brandenburger Hof made this our best city break ever. The people of Berlin and the Brandenburger Hof are the friendliest and most helpful we have experienced in all our travels throughout Europe. We will most definitely be back. If we could, we'd move in! We arrived on our birthday itself - and although we didn't mention this in our booking, the very friendly Sebastian at the front desk noticed the date in our passports. Later that evening we came back from dinner to find a scrumptious and beautiful dark chocolate mousse cake decorated with fresh berries delivered to our room. We ordered some mint tea to go with it - and another very friendly member of staff served it to us in Bauhaus style tea pots full to bursting with fresh spearment leaves. The hotel is simply beautiful - very intimate and quiet, incredibly relaxing and stylish. The hotel interior is full of Bauhaus and Asian antiques and the interior garden is a work of art in itself. Even though the hotel was full and our room faced the street, we never heard a peep at night and we had the best sleep throughout our stay. There is a private spa, pool and health club within 5 minutes from the hotel - and a free limo service there and back is available at anytime. But there's so much to do and see in Berlin that we didn't have time to try it. And the food! We didn't eat in the Michelin starred Die Quadriga because we had planned a number of cultural activities for the evenings but we sampled the hotel's wonderful breakfast each day. A lovely touch that I have never seen offered by other 5 star hotels is the hotel's relaxed approach to breakfast - and highly civilised in my opinion. Technically the hotel stops serving breakfast at the generous time of 10.30am. However, the staff let us know that we can come down at any time and the full menu would be available. So we were able to sleep in. It's great to not feel the pressure after a late night to rush down for breakfast. I have never seen a more original breakfast menu on any hotel I've stayed in. Delicious, healthy and beautifully presented - with excellent coffee. Another wonderful thing is the opportunity to have high tea in the lounge over looking the garden. Each day there are different cakes and pastries available and later on in the evening, you can order delicious small plates at the Bauhaus-styled bar. It felt very special to be staying there - and we immediately felt at home, so much so that we did not want to leave. We decided to stay in the former West Berlin because we wanted somewhere relaxing and peaceful away from the very busy tourist areas in Mitte. But it was a cinch to get to all the sights - either by walking through the gorgeous Tiergarten or via the UBahn - the nearest station is 3 minutes away at the end of the street on Eislebener Strasse. The UBahn is incredibly efficient, fast and inexpensive - but there are also plenty of taxis that are reasonably priced. It was lovely to have somewhere relaxing to come home to after hectic days and nights and there are lots of interesting sights and a huge amount of shopping within walking distance of the hotel. We're both very surprised that the Brandenburger Hof isn't higher up the list of best hotels in Berlin - for us it's one of the very best in Europe. It must be due to the cost and the fact that it is in the West part of the city. It's true that the hotel is not inexpensive - however we were on a budget and booked the hotel in advance to avail of the generous discount. Also we found that Berlin was far less expensive in general compared to other European cities - both in terms of flights and costs on the ground - so we felt this justified a splurge on the hotel! We both feel it was money very well spent as staying at this hotel made our first trip to Berlin our best travelling experience as a couple so far. We're already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary elegance in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: gmbklm
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Brandenburger Hof twice, most recently March 2011. It is a very elegant small hotel located in a quiet side street, not far from the smart end of Kurfurstendamme. The hotel has been beautifully designed and built, with extremely high quality modern fittings and decoration. Meticulous attention to detail. There is a very nice glazed enclosed courtyard, for breakfast and drinks. The reception desk staff were very welcoming, very professional and efficient. Friendly but not intrusive. Perfect for a small high quality hotel. A particular thanks to Mr Sanchez, the extremely helpful concierge. Our double deluxe courtyard room was spacious, extremely comfortable and very quiet. It was also very light due to large floor to ceiling windows. It had a very nice sofa area. We had a very spacious contemporary bathroom, with very high quality fixtures and fittings. Our bed was very comfortable with wonderful high quality linen. Everything was meticulously well maintained and spotlessly clean. For the quality of the public areas, rooms and service, it represents excellent value for money. We paid circa EUR 270 / night for a deluxe double courtyard. Our breakfast was excellent. Best to get included in your rate. For a change, we also had a good but much less refined breakfast at the nearby Literature House. Die Quadriga restaurant is definitely worth trying. We had some very interesting and sophisticated dishes. Some worked very well and had great taste and flavour, whilst others were simply complex - but I think that's the nature of new Nordic cuisine. Essential to try some of their wonderful German wines, or to take their excellent wine glass per dish option. The restaurant service was good, but not as friendly or as efficient as the hotel reception - we seemed to be forgotten about whilst drinking our aperitif in the lounge. Expect to pay around EUR 400 for 2 in total inc drinks. We very strongly recommend the Brandenburger Hof. An excellent small hotel. And do try the restaurant and German wines. We shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Trappy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch! The breakfast was a marvel, the room was extremely comfortable and fit for purpose. The restaurant was excellent but expensive but hey everything is to Brits these days!

Reviews.Title: “Refined and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: BaskervilleHound
Reviews.Content: Our visit was for about ten days, and the Brandenburger Hof made a perfect base both for exploring Berlin, and for slightly further afield visits to Potsdam and the Bauhaus at Dessau. Only a short walk to the Ku'dam but in a quieter area, we loved the location. Beautifully designed and situated in an urbane residential neighborhood, the hotel interior is a lovely mix of early nineteenth century furniture and artwork with German modernism and contemporary European furniture and art. The vibe is contemporary but the architecture and older portraits and landscapes were beautiful compliments to the twentieth century furniture. A giant neoclassical KPM urn contrasts the Bauhaus designed furniture. in the lobby. The concierge service is a first rate: friendly and they know the city's nooks and crannies. They arranged an English tour of the Dessau Bauhaus, coordinating our train tickets. Boutique art and design bookstores? They know them all. And their restaurant recommendations were wonderful. Rooms are located on the upper floors facing a courtyard, part of which has been enclosed as a winter garden. We had a room with sitting area, generous bath outfitted in limestone and marble, but possibly disappointing to Americans accustomed to the huge bathrooms of corporate hotels. Breakfast is delicious with homemade yogurts, fresh juiced and is served in the enclosed portion of the winter garden which is also a wonderful place for an afternoon coffee, or a drink following dinner. I recommend at least one meal in Die Quadriga, the hotel's intimate restaurant. Wonderful local ingredients, amazing German wines, served amidst lovely furniture and artwork. Staff is welcoming – impeccable but never overly formal or intrusive. I hope to find my way back here one day.

Reviews.Title: “This could be my favourite hotel, not just in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Skippy50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Brandenburger Hof several times over the past few years and I have never tired of the hotel or the welcome, from door man to reception and all restaurant staff. Whilst this is not the cheapest hotel in Berlin, for me it is good value when I look at the comfort levels, attention to detail and the quality food. Rooms are a decent size for a city centre and certainly larger than similar hotels in Berlin, and the winter garden / conservatory breakfast room with rooms opening off is a great place to wake up over the excellent breakfast: snow on the courtyard garden added to its charm.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for us--unequivocal praise!”
Reviews.Author: Felicity25
Reviews.Content: This comfortable and unpretentious hotel is hard to fault . The location is ideal , the street quiet and leafy. The glazed enclosed courtyard gives a spacious and airy feel. The service is soothing and impeccable, the breakfasts stunningly original and so delicious. Lessons in scrambled egg required--no milk!! but the quails eggs on hollandaise with crispy bacon were to die for, ditto the smoked salmon. And those wonderful breads..... after this the mundane attempts of French and Italian hotels to provide this most important of meals will be even more painful to endure. The dinner was elegant and indeed, many locals come to enjoy the talents of this exceptional chef. Peruse the prices carefully on the menu-the White Lady tea was more than we expected and a bit of a surprise! Can't wait for an excuse to go again--a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance is an attitude”
Reviews.Author: gravediggersdaughter
Reviews.Content: And yes, this hotel has both. The hotel is nicely located on a residential street, and you wouldn't expect such an elegant hotel to be set here. The hotel is a nice mix of city chic (clean and airy) and old world, and there are special touches that remind you that you are staying in a five-star hotel. I can fully recommend their spa treatments at the Thalelia (in-house), although they are pricy. Although I cannot rate the restaurant, the breakfast is wonderful, with a la carte wishes executed exactly as desired. This is really not a hotel for "in-out" stays, and I would recommend it for anyone who is sightseeing in Berlin for a few days. There is nothing to fault about the service, although sometimes you meet up with a young person who is "in training" and not fully equipped with the necessary graces to put up with some demanding guests - that means - some of them have "an attitude". But this is excusable. In principle, the overall elegance overrides this in every way. I look forward to returning to this hotel and enjoying the friendly, yet practiced discretion of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Billing Experiences EVER at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flentini
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for the past three months to different cities in Europe. The Brandenburger Hof was by far the worst experience I had throughout my trip. The admistration was unforgiving for removing a day from our contract, because our group had to leave a day earlier to our next city. They charged our credit card for all incidentals, after being told several times to collect each individuals credit card for their own incidentals. Please tell me how a Holiday Inn or Best Western can understand this concept.. But a supposedly high end hotel couldn't compute it? Overall my whole experience of just constantly dealing with no sympathy or proper office accomidations, made my stay disgusting and made me nausea. WARNING!!! DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU EVER GO TO BERLIN!!! Besides... it is extremely far away from the center of action in Berlin... Which is all in East Berlin. The 15 mn cab rides got old around week two. (and expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Despite its great ambience and potential - my stay turned in a Fawlty Towers sketch.”
Reviews.Author: JBCO
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately a last minute decision to stay at the Branderburger Hof on New Years Eve, turned into a Basil Fawlty sketch. Whilst my initial impression was very positive, despite a different room allocation, the stay turned out to be particularly disappointing. In short - a series of stuff ups occured - which were never fully explained - from staff walking into your room unannounced late at night (on the fourth occasion in less than 90 minutes - who when asked had nothing to say and fled) - to the front desk being unattended for more than 30 minutes when wanting to make a complaint - doors being repeatedly slammed by hotel staff ... to hearing staff argue loudly the follow morning about the availability of "brotchen" when ordering breakfast - spoilt what should have been a lovely NYE. Given the hotel's ambience and reputation, I would like to think this was a once off event. However given I am yet to hear back from the hotel regarding my concerns, despite a commitment to do so (now over a week ago), I won't be recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RobD99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in mid September 2009. The hotel was excellent. It is relaxing, the service is excellent and the breakfast is just so different it has to be tried. Whilst they do not have spa/pool on site the arrangement with the sports club nearby works very well indeed. Finally the concierge service, run by Jorn Vlokmann, help direct us to some excellent, good value restaurants. Jorn knows Berlin. Take advantage of his knowledge. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: medorand
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brandenburger Hof is excellent in every way. The staff anticipate your needs and work incredibly hard. The lobby and courtyard are breezy and light with beautiful furnishings and artful plants and flowers. It feels very zen. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. We stayed in room 210, which had a small balcony and plenty of space. I loved the bowl full of fresh cherries in the mornings. What a lovely little treat. And speaking of treats: the breakfast spread (included with the stay) is immaculate. They provide a tray of meats, cheeses, and spreads, bring coffee and fresh-squeezed juices, have a bar of pastries, jam, and cereals, and on top of all that let you order from a menu! It was beyond generous and everything was delicious. The only things I can fault the hotel for are the silly twin beds that make up a double (when will European hotels quit making this grave mistake...it's not acceptable!), and the balcony that adjoins with another room (if you forget to lock your balcony doors it could be a problem). Otherwise, I would say the experience is just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Posh luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacAndrew
Reviews.Content: The service was almost invasive, albeit polite and in perfect English. The multi-uniformed staff were willing and able to assist with every little thing. The senior staff had distinctive uniforms and each area: kitchen, reception and concierge were fitted out in a different colour. The bell boys even wore a hat. The duty manager was distinctive in a darker and multi-coloured uniform. The room was immaculate. It had comfortable beds, complimentary fruit and water, TV (albeit with fewer than expected channels), writing desk, couch, wonderful bathroom, slippers, DVD and balcony. There were a selection of books in German in the room. The hotel is located in a quiet suburban street near public transport. It is within walking distance of the Kurfürstendamm, Kaiser William Memorial Church and the zoo. Sadly, it is quite distant from the health, leisure and swimming pool advertised as "associated" with the hotel. The hotel's restaurant, Die Quadriga, is an experiential award winning entity. We stayed one afternoon for tea and cake and were charged 28 Euros, excluding tip. The DVDs are 9.99 Euros to purchase and 14.95 Euros to rent. The included breakfast is an special occasion coming with its own brochure and, as well as the normal breakfast components in a tiered tray with yogurt, muesli and fruit in separate dishes, comes with beef tartare with caper and anchovy, pancake with maple syrup (tiny), and, optionally, small portions, one of tomatoes and bell peppers, artichokes and balsamic vinegar, salmon and beetroot, herring and mustard, pikeperch and almond, chorizo and fennel, roastbeef and celery or quail and pear. An additional cooked dish of eggs and bacon is also offered. Three, four and five course meals for dinner were available at increasing higher rates per person and we didn't dare look at the wine list. There appeared to be nowhere to go and relax away from the ubiquitous staff. The concept of peace and quiet seemed foreign, although tipping is allowed I noticed. Breakfast has to be experienced but the ubiquitous presence of uniformed staff was unwelcome. We ate out and easily found our own way around this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: THEAPPRENTICELONDON
Reviews.Content: The Branderburger Hof IS A CLASS ACT. A clue is in the name, and is quickly confirmed on arrival. THE RED CARPET is permanent, and you may catch sight of ANGELA MERKEL arriving for a function. There is an understated sense of quality about the BRANDENBURGER HOF which should sit easily with discerning British guests. Once inside, you appreciate the skilful mix of traditional and modern which makes the BH quite simply THE best hotel in BERLIN. The staff are friendly and attentive; the cuisine modern and clean; the roomscomfortable and well appointed. As with all such class acts the key is management. Both the owner DANIELA SAUTER and the GM MARKUS OTTO GRAF are visible and the staff react accordingly. NOTHING IS TOO MUCH TROUBLE, AND IT COMES AS NO SURPRISE THAT THEY CAN ARRANGE ACCESS TO EVENTS FEW IF ANY CAN MATCH. Although not a spa hotel the BH can organise a great range of treatments for the weary or those who just want pampering. THE WINE LIST OFFERS OVER 900 EXAMPLES OF GERMAN WINES WHICH IS UNEQUALLED ANYWHERE. FOR THOSE IN NEED OF RAPID RECHARGING THE BH IS WITHOUT EQUAL.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel a few times - and it is always great. If you book a hotel transfer from the airport you have water and magazines in your car. What even more amazed me the first time I stayed at the hotel is - when the doorman open the car door for me he greeted me immediatly with my name, even though he had never seen me before! The rooms are modern and very comfortable. Great are the small treats you get each day in your cream, such as small cakes, fresh fruits etc. Even when travelling alone, you get it for two - yummi! The breakfast is to die for! And dinner in the Michelin starred restaurant is a must too. You will definitely be looked after in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wear a nice suit”
Reviews.Author: SeriousJuice
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of my honeymoon - booked four nights, limo pick up from airport with fruit & champagne on arrival included. Arrived into Berlin at 11PM, no sign of the limo, rang the desk and they had no record of my reservation. No mention of them sending a taxi so I made my own way to the hotel. More fun on arrival - I had to produce a copy of the email they sent me confirming my reservation before they believed me. Fair enough; things happen. A room had to be made up and we were left standing in the lobby, no offer of a coffee or something stronger while we waited. When the room was ready we were brought up and we had to get into an argument with a cranky but well dressed concierge before the champagne and fruit was provided. We'd arrived from Salzburg after a long train journey from Austria and had dressed accordingly. On arrival we were tired, shaken and looked it. I can't help thinking that if I was wearing a swanky suit I would have got a lot more satisfaction. That said it's a beautiful hotel and the staff were very helpful for the rest of our stay. Great uniforms!

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: Superb and discreet service are among the many positives of the hotel. Most of the staff is fluent in English and almost always cheery. the hotel is a short distance from the famous KaDeWe store and the Kurfurstendam. The room was - #417 - very spacious with three windows overlooking the hotel's central courtyard. Apart from a gigantic bathroom with two sinks and a large tub there was a separate toilet room with its own sink. WiFi service is fee based but of a high quality. The restaurant - Quadriga - has an amazing multi course tasting menu that has a range of delicately flavored mediterranean items and a slew of freebies from the chef. Be prepared for a very long stay as a four course dinner can last nearly 3 hours. The negatives include the absence of a gym and the somewhat slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Business Hotel in the Heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Scanvest
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in the Heat of Berlin, with a couple of minutes walk from Ku'damm. For the price of a standard room in an international chain, you get to stay in this fine old-school hotel that is quiet, private and very central. Every time I stay in Berlin on Business I choose to stay here. Great Concierge, Exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable staff, fantastic breakfast and one of the best restaurants in Berlin, with a great selection of wines and great sommelier. (But the seats in the breakfast room are seriously uncomfortable). Great business location with lots of sofas/tables to meet clients. The rooms are a little minimalist, with a black and green theme, but the beds are exceptionally comfortable, and the hotel is very quiet. There is no gym. When staying here, you feel you are staying in a very personable 10 bedroom hotel rather than large international hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not my cup of tea.”
Reviews.Author: darwindc
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, gives the feeling of being smaller than it actually is. I found the minimalist approach in the rooms a bit sterile to be honest and have seen it done better elsewhere (Hotel Josef in Prague for one). The restaurant setting is really good but the service at dinner was a tad slow, and overly fussy. Good to try but you wouldn't want to go through the little plate menu every night - shame because the flavours were sensational! Breakfast was interesting and certainly unique - but would become tedious quite quickly. Staff were really friendly and I wouldn't disagree with any of the other reviews. Short weekend in Berlin - perfect. Lone Business traveller - probably not. Not the best I've stayed in by a long way, but certainly in the top half.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the expense”
Reviews.Author: realwit1965
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel, 5 minutes walk from the Ku'Damm and 10 minutes from KaDeWe. The rooms are clean and stylishly furnished and the beds are comfortable. The staff are polite and helpful and breakfast is plentiful, well presented and served in the conservatory which surrounds the oasis that is the central, Japanese inspired courtyard garden. However, only the demi-suites are airconditioned. We booked a 3 night package in a standard room and didn't realise this. We were allocated a room at the front of the hotel. The weather was hot and humid and there was a lot of noise from the traffic and the building works in the flats opposite so we couldn't have the windows open. After one night, we explained the difficulties and asked if we could move. We were told that they had a demi-suite available but we would have to pay for the upgrade. £82.00 per night is a lot to pay for the privilege of being cool and quiet and it really took the shine off our trip. We wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Class act 4.9 star hotel - but not all rooms are airconditioned!”
Reviews.Author: jdf3361
Reviews.Content: There is virtually no way to give any negative review comments about this hotel. It is a true 5 star, in my opinion, in every way. BUT, there is one significant exception. The single rooms do not, I repeat DO NOT have air-conditioning. Perhaps this is not a regular issue but given that it was 31C on the day of my arrival it was absolutely horrendous. Essentially, you must upgrade to a demi-suite at a significant price increase to garner AC. Perhaps I am just a spoiled American, but at north of $300 a night I do think that having AC is not totally unreasonable. They, otherwise, take care of every whim that you may have including a breakfast that is the most elegant that I have ever experienced in any locale. A courtesy limo to/from the airport, complimentary bottle of champagne, Michelin rated restaurant. The clientele of this 78 room hotel included, on my day of departure, an Italian diplomat who received a 20 man police escort and motorcade. The hotel is set two blocks from the K'Damm and, accordingly, very centrally located. There are tons of reasonable and quite good restaurants within a several block area. If you like Turkish food, one is less than 2 blocks away and the food is most excellent. Were it not for the AC, this hotel would receive 5 stars from me rather than the 4 that I have provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: m320au
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night (was in the room for about 6 hours) but struck me as a very pleasant and well run boutique hotel. Arrived in a group yet was individually escorted to my room, fresh fruit waiting, very friendly staff. Fantastic breakfast consisting of literally 20 courses served on tiny plates in a large stone garden room, naturally lit with creeping plants everywhere. Everything you touch has a german proverb attached, asked reception for a packet of cigarettes at midnight & they first placed it in a sleeve saying "tobacco is the substance of dreams and relaxation" or something and explained it to me in detail. Exceptionally well run, suit regular business traveller or a romantic getaway - rooms very modern and everything spotless, high attention to detail. My only complaint was that of the 7 pillows provided per bed I surprisingly couldn't find one of a comfortable size but manufacturing a pile of 4 smaller ones did the trick. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - again”
Reviews.Author: Ralff
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Brandenburger Hof; the first was 2 years ago. Had a 1st floor suite (2nd floor US); had room noise from the conference rooms below both early and late with set-up and take down. Ask for one of the higher floor rooms. Service was excellent again, although it seemed less intimate this time, and the server staff at the bar disappears. Breakfast is good. The one thing in need of help is the Wintergarden seating - totally uncomfortable. The Wintergarden is beautiful. The location is great for everything you want and it is in a residential neighborhood. The front desk, door and the concierge are top notch for help, from the 100 bus to dining. I'll keep staying here when we go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: harryohk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Brandenburg Hof in early August 2006. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, we found the hotel wonderful. we arrived in a heavy rainstorm, for which the porter apologised so profusely thathe seemed to consider it to be his own fault! The poor guy was soaked as he unloaded our bags from our car. We had booked a suite, and stayed in "Suite Oberon". The bedroom & study area were a good size,and elegantly decorated with very individual pieces of furniture. I especially liked a wonderful area rug in the study. The bed was firm, but very comfortable. I noted that one reviewer commented on the quality of the duvets & pillows. In hindsight, the reviewer was right, but it did not impact on my enjoyment of the hotel, nor did I remark on it at the time. The Michelin-starred Quadriga restaurant was on summer break at the time of our visit, but the Quadriga Lounge provided a wonderful breakfast, quite unlike anything I've had elsewhere. The service in the restaurant, and throughout the hotel, was warm and efficient throughout our stay. I would highly reommend this property for anybody looking for something a deal different from the cookie-cutter 5 star properties that abound in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elysia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel. The room was well appointed with classic design furniture overlooking a beautiful courtyard. The windows opened onto the courtyard for fresh air. The food was wonderful. The breakfast was the best we had ever enjoyed in a hotel. So beautifully presented. The location was also very convenient. Our only complaint was the quality of the synthetic duvet and pillow which were respectively very hot and lumpy and made sleeping difficult. A hotel of this standard should provide down (at least on request). We did request down pillows and we were treated as if we were completely unreasonable. They advised they didn't have any in the hotel - but if it was so important they would go out and buy 2 down pillows. They did go out and buy these pillows and made us feel uncomfotable about it until we left. So silly. Don't let this put you off - the other features of the hotel made up for this unnecessary incident.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: safarimad
Reviews.Content: I stay in many excellent hotels around the world but the Brandenburger Hof is certainly top of my list! A wonderful, elegant, classy, friendly hotel with superb service! The decor is very tasteful and done with great flair. The decor does not feel as if a team of professional designers have 'done' the hotel but rather as if each item of furniture, piece of art etc has been specially chosen by the owner. The food is excellent and the breakfast is a treat! The greatest attribute of the hotel though is the staff. Everyone is friendly without being obsequious. My 11 year old daughter joined me for the weekend and everyone went out of their way to ensure she had a special time. There is nowhere else to stay in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LehGo
Reviews.Content: With Berlin seeing a new five-star hotel opening every other month, the classics seem to remain the real thing. Located 5 minutes from the Western city center, Brandenburger Hof is set in a quiet residential side street. The hotel is a period building, just the right size for the traveller who looks for quiet comfort and personal service. The highlight is the Japanese-style courtyard, where you can sip your aperitif in a light-flooded winter garden, or have breakfast. Service is personal and very friendly. The rooms are nicely decorated, but probably a bit on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class!!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunni
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure class. Superlatives won't do it justice; it simply must be experienced for itself. The rooms are filled with bauhaus treasures, the staff are charming, the breakfast is wonderful & served in a delightful, sunfilled covered courtyard. I simply cannot reccommend it highly enough to anyone wishing to visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The one and only”
Reviews.Author: Malina
Reviews.Content: Whenever we have business people to accomodate, the Brandenburger Hof is where we set them up. It's the best value that you can get for your money. With a breathtakingly beautiful (glass roofed) courtyard, extremely attentive staff, elegant, quiet rooms and georgeous food it is the most comfortable place to be in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Life
Reviews.Content: This was definitely my best hotel experience ever! The service was incredible. The staff were very attentive. The bed was extremely comfortable. It has a quiet atmosphere, but is just a few blocks from the noise of this great, beautiful city. This is a small boutique hotel that is picture perfect. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous small hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sacha1
Reviews.Content: a friend told me about the hotel brandenburger hof in berlin, germany. it is a small hotel off the main street, close to shopping and the berlin zoo. the rooms overlooking the garden area are wonderfully furnished in the "mies" style. the concierge service was above and beyond and the front desk/door hotel staff were most gracious and accommodating. the die quadriga restaurant is a must with food and service both excellent. this is a hotel to remember if you are traveling to berlin. i contacted them directly for reservations.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Every superlative you read is correct. The staff is totally committed to serving your travel dining experience. The location is quiet, 1 block from the underground, 2 blocks from KuDamm, and where you want to be for shopping and comfort. Food (breakfast in the Wintergarden is a full-american breakfast); for dinner eat in the gourmet restaurant and go for the gourmet menu with wines. Concierge service is knowledgable and helpful. Granted, we had one of the 4 suites, but AWESOME and WOW (and thanks for ag reat stay) are the words we had upon our departure. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: deanna7742
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been added to our short list of great hotels. The room was beautiful, the food fantastic, and the concierge was constantly trying to make our stay enjoyable. The staff was attentive without being cloying and it seemed that anything we needed or wanted, they made happen. One member of our party had lost some much needed medicine and the hotel called some personal contacts to get the medicine replaced. The most elegant and varied breakfast buffet I've ever seen. Somebody still knows how a hotel ought to be run!

HotelInfo.Name: Brandenburger Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Eislebener Strasse 14 | Schöneberg, 10789 Berlin, Germany
